PYCBC-941: Build against correct OpenSSL version on Windows

Motivation
----------
On Windows, the OpenSSL headers and libraries required to build
libcouchbase with TLS support may not be present on the system.
These are very specific to the Python version, so it would be
most convenient for the build to optionally detect and
download the right ones.

Changes
-------
Move all code/config generation for PYCBC into gen_config.py.
Use the `ssl` module to introspect the OpenSSL version required for
Python. If PYCBC_SSL_FETCH is set to 'ALL' or 'GITHUB', attempt
to pull in the right binary dependencies from the cpython-bin-deps
repository.

Results
-------
When PYCBC_SSL_FETCH is set to GITHUB or ALL, OpenSSL is pulled in
and SSL is built against and passes tests.

PYCBC-954 Can't query on cloud instances

Motivation
==========
We want to query against cloud instances.

Modification
============
The cloud restricts the rest interface a bit, including the /pools
endpoint which we used to determine the cluster version.  This was
to workaround an issue where we couldn't query on an lcb connection
which is opened as a cluster instance unless the cluster was 6.5
or greater.  CCBC-1204 should take care of that - this was temporary
workaround code only.  So now, lets just notice that error and assume
it is the cloud.

Results
=======
Existing tests all pass, should run fine against a cloud instance.

Change-Id: I9646dfdd8f4cb93cd198662962318bcb01044a49
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/c/couchbase-python-client/+/131197
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Ellis Breen <ellis.breen@couchbase.com>

PYCBC-925 Tests need to ensure the services are up

Motivation
==========
Lets have the tests be sure the expected services are up before
running a test on one of them.  Mainly a stability thing, so we
don't run into flaky integration tests when a test cluster is slow
to come up.

Modification
============
Ping does the job.  However there is a ping bug - it doesn't break
out the Analytics, and instead reports it with the Query.  So, it
isn't perfect.  Lets see how that goes.  Eventually wait_until_ready
will be implemented in LCB, and we can use that instead.

While here, fixed up some intermittently failing integration tests,
and added something to help tests when we move to testing against
7.0 candidates (shortly).

Disconnect link prior to any analytics mgmt ops.

Results
=======
No new tests, hoping they are a bit less likely to have flaky results.

PYCBC-928: provide bootstrap timeout option, fix flaky tests

Motivation
----------

Provide access to the bootstrap tiemout setting via
ClusterTimeoutOptions. Make some tests more resiliant
to variabile timing.

Changes
-------

Add config_total_timeout to ClusterTimeoutOptions.
Use ConnectionString in Admin constructor for more robust
behaviour.

Give unlock operation longer to complete.

Various test refinements.

Remove debugging statement (cluster_info not present prior to call to super().setUp().
Adapt to new "DocumentUnretrievable" error code returned by LCB for nonextant host.

Results
-------

Flaky tests run more reliably.

PYCBC-928  Bootstrapping timeouts using Centos

Motivation
==========
We should be able to connect to a running cluser on Centos reliably.

Modification
============
We seem to be running out of file descriptors on Centos.  So, if we
never make a cluster when these tests are skipped, you'd think we could
avoid it.  If so, we can retrofit other tests to do same.

Result
======
Waiting with great anticipation

PYCBC-912: Docstrings second pass

Motivation
----------

Improve the API documentation, cover Options and
core functionality.

Changes
-------

Sphinx wasn't recognising the signature from boltons.wraps and it appears
functools.wraps does the job better, so swap out for this, and drop boltons
as a dependency.

Remove redundant param types in docstrings now that Sphinx can
use the type hints.

Add expected exceptions to try_n_times/try_n_times_until_exception, use both in collection_t.

General reorganisation of OptionBlocks hierarchy to reduce
boilerplate.

Results
-------
Test pass as before, full type hints in documentation. Still
many parts to improve correct but much better coverage.

PYCBC-918: Centralise mock auth workaround code

Motivation
==========
We should keep the code to work around the issues with
authenticating the Mock in one place as far as possible.

Modification
============
Add a 'mock_hack_options' function that takes an 'is_mock' parameter
and returns the parameters relevant to the workaround, via
a MockHackOptions named tuple.

Some other minor tweaks; unpin basictracer as older versions failed
to install on some platforms, perform kv operations on collection rather
than bucket.

Results
=======
Passing tests against mock and a 6.5 and 6.0 cluster locally.

Change-Id: I73063269a77357e04f1dca29c4d071bf23e4f2f1
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/c/couchbase-python-client/+/127360
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Tested-by: Ellis Breen <ellis.breen@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: David Kelly <davidmichaelkelly@gmail.com>

PYCBC-918 Admin connection had default bucket in it.

Motivation
==========
Should not require a bucket with a specific name exists for our
client to work.

Modification
============
We pass in no bucket now.  However, if you open a bucket, and the
admin connection has not been created yet, we open the admin connection
with that bucket first.  Then use it to open the bucket.

Though it seems like the bucket should not be necessary at all, it is
so far.  The real solution here is to just not have an Admin object, and
instead use the Cluster itself.  This, however, is complicated when
using the async interfaces.  For now we can create the admin using the first
bucket you open, and that will allow < 6.5 clusters to do admin stuff as
long as they open a bucket first. They already have to do this to do actual
queries, etc..  So not a surprise.  We can then deal with the need for a
bucket at all, and simplify (removing admin completely perhaps) soon.

Results
=======
Passing tests against mock and a 6.5 and 6.0 cluster locally.

Change-Id: Ic2593dea03afd3298d816e215df0df2f2b609059
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/c/couchbase-python-client/+/127641
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Ellis Breen <ellis.breen@couchbase.com>
